name: RequestTeamAccess
description:
Request to join a team on Vercel.

This tool allows users to request access to a specific team on Vercel as a member. The request needs to be approved by a team owner, and only 10 users can have pending requests for a team at the same time.

parameters.name: team_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the Vercel team you want to join.

parameters.name: join_request_details
parameters.description: JSON containing details of the join request, such as origin, repository info, and user ID. Required fields include 'origin'. Optional fields include 'commitId', 'repoId', 'repoPath', 'gitUserId', and 'gitUserLogin'.

commitId.description: The commit sha if the origin is a git provider.

repoId.description: The ID of the repository for the given Git provider.

repoPath.description: The path to the repository for the given Git provider.

gitUserId.description: The ID of the Git account of the user who requests access.

gitUserLogin.description: The login name for the Git account of the user who requests access.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the vercel API.

commitId.description: The commit sha if the origin is a git provider.

repoId.description: The ID of the repository for the given Git provider.

repoPath.description: The path to the repository for the given Git provider.

gitUserLogin.description: The login name for the Git account of the user who requests access.
